questions.title: Present Simple Usage
questions.htmlContent: Choose the correct form of the verb: She _____ (to go) to school every day.
questions.feedback: The correct answer is 'goes'. In present simple, the verb takes an 's' for third person singular.

questions.title: Prepositions of Time
questions.htmlContent: Select all correct prepositions: I have a meeting _____ Monday _____ 3 PM.
questions.feedback: The correct prepositions are 'on' for days and 'at' for specific times.

questions.title: Simple Past Tense
questions.htmlContent: Is the sentence correct? 'He didn't went to the party yesterday.'
questions.feedback: The sentence should be 'He didn't go to the party yesterday.'

questions.title: Comparatives and Superlatives
questions.htmlContent: Complete the sentence: This book is _____ (interesting) than the one I read last week.
questions.feedback: The correct form is 'more interesting' for comparative degree.

questions.title: Question Formation
questions.htmlContent: Select the correct question: _____ does she prefer, tea or coffee?
questions.feedback: 'Which' is used when choosing between two or more items.

questions.title: Modal Verbs for Ability
questions.htmlContent: Complete the sentence: He _____ swim when he was five.
questions.feedback: 'Could' is used to talk about past abilities.

questions.title: Short Answer: Daily Routine
questions.htmlContent: Describe your daily routine in a short paragraph.

questions.title: Understanding Adverbs
questions.htmlContent: Is the adverb correctly used? 'She sings very beautifully.'
questions.feedback: Yes, 'beautifully' is an adverb that correctly modifies the verb 'sings'.

questions.title: Listening Comprehension
questions.htmlContent: Listen to the audio and answer the question: What is the main topic of the conversation?
questions.feedback: The correct answer will be based on the audio content.
